pros: Owner is awesome. She really cares about her employees. Very accessible, will talk to you either by email or phone any time you need to talk to her.
cons: No cons to mention as of now

review_title: Upward mobility for students - not for employees
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great place for upward mobility for students. There are many students of low-income backgrounds who flourish after taking classes here.
cons: Sadly, no upward movement for the employees.

pros: The college is on the cutting edge of most practices in the educational and technological environment. There are great people who work here, and it is very easy to make professional connections.
cons: It is appalling how little attention to the students the faculty and administration takes. It is very hard to work for something you do not believe in, and it is apparent that the administration does not want to invest in a better learning environment so we can get better crowds through the halls, not low intelligence street cases.

review_title: Great for someone who just needs a paycheck
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: There are decent benefits with the union in the company but they are slowly being taken away being as the union is week and the upper management only cares about profit growth..regardless of whether its from increased revenue or cuts to overhead. (ie. layoffs)
cons: There is no room for growth. Most of the people working there have been for 10+ years and managment is somehow all related to eachother or been friends for years. The company as a whole doesnt care too much about retaining talent.

review_title: it used to be exciting to work here
job_title: Maintenance Manager in New York, NY
pros: free tuition for dependents,, friendly environment, location, extremely dedicated to trying to make it work
cons: no upper management structure and a lack of filling vacant positions causing employees to do 2 different jobs for the pay of the one position you started at job morale down due to pay cuts constantantly

pros: Great staff in Career Services, they are very invested seeing the students succeed and offer lots of services to assist them with internships and job placement. The students are very challenging but it is rewarding to help them be successful!
cons: Declining enrollment has led to pay cuts and numerous rounds to layoffs, it's a very unstable environment with extremely low employee morale. Those employees  that are left are trying to escape as soon as they can.

pros: TCI has a rich history in NYC.  Centrally located across the street from Penn Station making it super accessible.
cons: TCI Management is clueless.  The school has regressed from a student-caring institution into a money hungry, cost cutting, scam of a school.  The treatment of the faculty and union has brought the moral and overall quality of teaching at the school.

cons: Bad management the school ran out of money and ideas to remain open.
